title: Siberia or Japan? Expert Google Maps Players Can Tell at a Glimpse.
abstract: In a game called GeoGuessr, competitors try to pinpoint where in the world a Google Street View image has been taken. Some can do it in seconds.

multimedia.caption: “It’s like a magician,” said Trevor Rainbolt, a prominent player of a quirky game called GeoGuessr. “To the magician, the trick is easy, but to everyone else, it’s a lot harder.”
multimedia.copyright: Jack Bool for The New York Times

title: How Wish Built (and Fumbled) a Dollar Store for the Internet
abstract: The number of users has plummeted, and its stock price has dropped. Former employees point to an emphasis on short-term growth over customer service.
byline: By Tiffany Hsu and Sapna Maheshwari

title: Start-Up Funding Falls the Most It Has Since 2019
abstract: The drop was another fallout of rising inflation and widespread economic uncertainty, and a retreat after years of a funding boom.

multimedia.caption: Domm Holland, who led the payments start-up Fast. The company recently shut down.
multimedia.copyright: Harry Murphy/Sportsfile for Web Summit via Getty Images

title: Steam Deck Review: A Game Console for the Quintessential Gamer
abstract: This new hand-held gaming device by Valve is lots of fun. But perhaps not as much if you’re a casual gamer.

multimedia.caption: The $400 Steam Deck by Valve, the company known for its Steam online games store.
The $400 Steam Deck by Valve, the company known for its Steam online games store.
The $400 Steam Deck by Valve, the company known for its Steam online games store.

title: Parents Sue TikTok, Saying Children Died After Viewing ‘Blackout Challenge’
abstract: The suit, involving girls ages 8 and 9, claims TikTok knew or should have known that its product was “addictive” and was directing children to dangerous content.
byline: By Michael Levenson and April Rubin

multimedia.caption: TikTok has said previously that the “blackout challenge” predated its platform and had never been a TikTok trend.
TikTok has said previously that the “blackout challenge” predated its platform and had never been a TikTok trend.
TikTok has said previously that the “blackout challenge” predated its platform and had never been a TikTok trend.

title: The Latin of Software Code Is Thriving
abstract: Next time you laugh at musty old tech, remember that new technologies are often built on it.

title: Disinformation Has Become Another Untouchable Problem in Washington
abstract: Numerous federal agencies agree that widely promoted falsehoods threaten the nation’s security. Doing something about them is another matter.
byline: By Steven Lee Myers and Eileen Sullivan

multimedia.caption: Nina Jankowicz became a target of disinformation while leading a new Department of Homeland Security advisory board on the issue.
multimedia.copyright: Jared Soares for The New York Times

title: ‘Ready to Rock, You Guys?’ The Winklevoss Twins Play Amagansett.
abstract: At the end of a tour that drew some social media mockery, the billionaire brothers’ rock band received a friendly reception at a venue close to their parents’ beach house.

multimedia.caption: Tyler Winklevoss, the Mars Junction frontman, moves through the crowd during a performance at the Stephen Talkhouse in Amagansett, N.Y.
multimedia.copyright: Johnny Milano for The New York Times

title: The Jumbled Dream of U.S. Chips
abstract: It’s even harder now to understand what the U.S. wants to accomplish with its computer chip plans.

title: How Wall Street Escaped the Crypto Meltdown
abstract: As cryptocurrency prices plunged and funds failed, strict rules on risky assets helped Wall Street companies sidestep the worst. Retail investors weren’t as lucky.

title: On Conservative Radio, Misleading Message Is Clear: ‘Democrats Cheat’
abstract: Election fraud claims from 2020 are widespread on talk radio, contributing to the belief that the midterm results cannot be trusted.

title: No Guns, No Dragons: Her Video Games Capture Private Moments
abstract: Nina Freeman, a leading indie game designer, infuses her work with a poetic sensibility far from the tone of mainstream shoot-’em-ups.

multimedia.caption: The video game designer Nina Freeman, who has a new game coming out next month, in her backyard in Frederick, Md.
multimedia.copyright: Schaun Champion for The New York Times

title: Tesla Sales Slow as the Pandemic Hobbles Production
abstract: The decline in deliveries by the electric carmaker in the second quarter was the first drop since the beginning of 2020. The main culprit was factory shutdowns in China.

multimedia.caption: Teslas at a sales and service center in Vista, Calif. The rising price of gasoline has increased the appeal of battery-powered vehicles.
Teslas at a sales and service center in Vista, Calif. The rising price of gasoline has increased the appeal of battery-powered vehicles.
Teslas at a sales and service center in Vista, Calif. The rising price of gasoline has increased the appeal of battery-powered vehicles.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Prepares Meta Employees for a Tougher 2022
abstract: In an internal meeting this week, Mr. Zuckerberg said the tech giant was facing one of the “worst downturns that we’ve seen in recent history.”
byline: By Mike Isaac and Sheera Frenkel

multimedia.caption: Mr. Zuckerberg added that the company — which owns Facebook, Instagram and other apps — was lowering its hiring targets.

title: Google Says It Will Delete Location Data When Users Visit Abortion Clinics
abstract: Under pressure from employees and supporters of reproductive rights, the company announced privacy changes for the post-Roe era.
des_facet: Dobbs v Jackson Women's Health Organization (Supreme Court Decision)

multimedia.caption: Supporters of reproductive rights marching in front of the Supreme Court on Thursday.

title: Father of Technoblade, YouTube Minecraft Star, Says His Son Has Died
abstract: He read his son’s final message on the YouTube channel where the 20-something had entertained more than 11 million subscribers with Minecraft gameplay and wry commentary. The title: “so long nerds.”

multimedia.caption: Technoblade’s father read a message from his son in a video announcement of his death that has been viewed more than 25 million times.
Technoblade’s father read a message from his son in a video announcement of his death that has been viewed more than 25 million times.
Technoblade’s father read a message from his son in a video announcement of his death that has been viewed more than 25 million times.

title: TikTok tells Republican senators how it plans to keep American data away from China.
abstract: “We know we are among the most scrutinized platforms from a security standpoint,” the video app’s chief executive wrote.

multimedia.caption: TikTok’s chief executive, Shou Zi Chew, wrote a letter to nine Republican senators.
TikTok’s chief executive, Shou Zi Chew, wrote a letter to nine Republican senators.
TikTok’s chief executive, Shou Zi Chew, wrote a letter to nine Republican senators.

title: Post-Roe, Her Facebook Group Went Viral
abstract: Veronica Risinger made a little online spot for neighbors to share information on abortion. Then 30,000 people joined.

title: Where TikTok-Like Dance Challenges Meet Network TV
abstract: “Dancing With Myself,” on NBC, shows the deep influence of the dance challenge on popular culture, even as its hold on TikTok has loosened.

multimedia.caption: A scene from “Dancing With Myself” on NBC. The pods suggest the boxed seclusion of a phone screen.
A scene from “Dancing With Myself” on NBC. The pods suggest the boxed seclusion of a phone screen.
A scene from “Dancing With Myself” on NBC. The pods suggest the boxed seclusion of a phone screen.

title: Deleting Your Period Tracker Won’t Protect You
abstract: Tweets telling women to do that went viral after Roe v. Wade was overturned, but experts say other digital data are more likely to reveal an illegal abortion.
des_facet: Dobbs v Jackson Women's Health Organization (Supreme Court Decision)

multimedia.caption: Downloads of apps that track menstrual cycles, like Flo’s, have risen rapidly since the Supreme Court overturned Roe v. Wade.
multimedia.copyright: Cayce Clifford for The New York Times

title: Substack is laying off 14% of its staff.
abstract: The newsletter start-up discussed raising funding last year but abandoned the plan after the market for venture investments cooled.

multimedia.caption: Chris Best, the Substack chief executive, announced cuts in an email to employees Wednesday.

title: Our Data Is a Curse, With or Without Roe
abstract: There is so much digital information about us out there that we can’t possibly control it all.

title: An F.C.C. commissioner pushes Apple and Google to remove TikTok from their app stores.
abstract: Brendan Carr, a Republican member of the Federal Communications Commission, said he was concerned that the Chinese-owned app could provide Beijing with access to the data of Americans.

multimedia.caption: Policymakers have long worried that TikTok’s Chinese parent company, ByteDance, could expose its data to the Chinese government.
Policymakers have long worried that TikTok’s Chinese parent company, ByteDance, could expose its data to the Chinese government.

title: Over 360 newspapers have closed since just before the start of the pandemic.
abstract: The same pace — about two closures per week — was occurring before the pandemic.

multimedia.caption: According to a new report, major media companies like Gannett have been quick to sell or shut down unsuccessful newspapers.
multimedia.copyright: Valerie Plesch for The New York Times

title: Use That Everyday A.I. in Your Pocket
abstract: Artificial intelligence powers more apps on your mobile devices than you may realize. Here’s how to take advantage of the technology — or turn it off.

multimedia.caption: The iOS Photos software for iPhone and iPad analyzes and automatically sorts your pictures into groups. Apple says all the facial recognition and scene and object detection are done directly on the device.

The iOS Photos software for iPhone and iPad analyzes and automatically sorts your pictures into groups. Apple says all the facial recognition and scene and object detection are done directly on the device.

title: Crypto Crash Widens a Divide: ‘Those With Money Will End Up Being Fine’
abstract: No cryptocurrency investor has been spared the pain of plunging prices. But the fallout from more than $700 billion in losses is far from even.

multimedia.caption: Tyler Winklevoss, left, and Cameron Winklevoss, center, performing with Mars Junction in Englewood, Colo. The billionaires recently laid off 10 percent of the staff at Gemini, their crypto firm.
Tyler Winklevoss, left, and Cameron Winklevoss, center, performing with Mars Junction in Englewood, Colo. The billionaires recently laid off 10 percent of the staff at Gemini, their crypto firm.

title: The Accidental Media Critics of YouTube
abstract: One of the most popular genres of videos online is to comment on other videos online. Are they comedians or media critics?

multimedia.copyright: Photo illustration by Karl Russell Vickers
Photo illustration by Karl Russell Vickers
Photo illustration by Karl Russell Vickers

title: The Work of Online Volunteers
abstract: Moderators’ work on Reddit and Facebook is crucial but not paid. We should be creative in how we compensate them.

title: Can Dual-Use Solar Panels Provide Power and Share Space With Crops?
abstract: Companies like BlueWave are betting on it. But the technology has its critics.
